essay.question-text: The professor describes an issue with knowledge transfer in business. Explain how this information on knowledge transfer is related to the concept of tacit knowledge.
essay.sample-answer-text:
SAMPLE ANSWER
In this set of materials, the reading passage discusses the concept of tacit knowledge, and the professor explains how the transfer of knowledge in business is affected by tacit knowledge.
In the reading passage, tacit knowledge is defined as unspoken knowledge that a person tells only after he or she is specifically asked. An example of this is when person A knows how to do something but provides incomplete information to person B because some of person A's knowledge is tacit knowledge. Person B has to ask questions to get more complete information from person A.
In the talk, the professor discusses how the concept of tacit knowledge can be applied to business. There is a problem with knowledge transfer in business, with conveying information from employee to employee. It is easy for a business to tell employees how to transfer knowledge, with a memo, or a conversation, or a report, for example. It is not easy, however, to ensure that all necessary knowledge is transferred because some knowledge that needs to be transferred is tacit knowledge.
